div.bibl: Revyen, July 23, 1898. [DANISH WEST INDIES AND THE SPANISH-AMERICAN WAR](Summary)

body.p: The governor of the Danish West Indies has prohibited all American war-ships from taking in coal at any Danish harbor, as coal is war contraband. The paper Bien reminds its readers that during the Civil War the governor of the same islands turned the cannons on an American man-of-war that tried to take in coal at the harbor of St. Thomas.
